423005. Ormuz is secured for Portugal

ORM — Not random

Conditions

  • Portugal exists
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 5 non-colonial provinces
  • Event 423001 - Ormuz takes the cap of Xeque Ismail for ORM has already occurred

Will happen within 30 days of October 1, 1515
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 1, 1516)

Description

In 1515 Albuquerque had the Persian governor of Ormuz, Reys Hamad, killed. He then had a fortress built in Ormuz and took control of Ormuz's arsenal making the Sheik of Ormuz a virtual puppet and giving Portugal control of Ormuz and its territory.

Actions

A. We have no choice but to submit to Portugal

  • Grant independence to GHR
  • Grant independence to HAA
  • Cede Zufar to HAA
  • Break vassalization with -1
  • +150 relations with Portugal
  • Stability +1

Back to top

423003. Ormuz is secured for Portugal

ORM — Not random

Conditions

  • Portugal exists
  • Country has at least 5 non-colonial provinces
  • Portugal controls Hum
  • Event 423001 - Ormuz takes the cap of Xeque Ismail for ORM has already occurred

Will happen within 30 days of October 1, 1515
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 1, 1516)

Description

In 1515 Albuquerque had the Persian governor of Ormuz, Reys Hamad, killed. He then had a fortress built in Ormuz and took control of Ormuz's arsenal making the Sheik of Ormuz a virtual puppet and giving Portugal control of Ormuz and its territory.

Actions

A. We have no choice but to submit to Portugal

  • Grant independence to GHR
  • Grant independence to HAA
  • Cede Zufar to HAA
  • Break vassalization with -1
  • Cede Masqat to Portugal
  • Cede Bahrein to Portugal

Back to top

423007. The Election of Nasr al-Yarubi

ORM — Not random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Oman exists

Will happen within 360 days of January 2, 1625
Checked again every 360 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1650)

Description

For over 300 years, naval powers have controlled the coast of Oman while the interior remained disunited, with the election of Nasr al-Yarubi as Imam, all that begins to change.

Actions

A. Hail the New Imam!

  • Flag graphics set to default
  • Become Oman
  • Centralization +2
  • Offensive Doctrine +1

B. Remain Loyal to Ormuz

  • Centralization -2
  • Stability -3

Back to top

423000. Ormuz submits to Portugal

ORM — Not random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 7 non-colonial provinces

Triggered by

Action A of 260033 - Ormuz engaged in large naval battle for Portugal

Description

In October of 1507 Afonso Albuquerque defeated Ormuz in a large naval battle, capturing the famous ship the Meri. Shortly after this Albuquerque's plans to build a fortress were cut short when Ormuz under the guidance of Cogeatar broke its vassalage to Portugal and three of Albuquerque's captains deserted him and sailed off to India.

Actions

A. Damn Portuguese!

  • Stability -1
  • Trade tech investment: -50
  • Break vassalization with Persia
  • Break vassalization with Ottoman Empire
  • Break vassalization with Mamluks
  • Break vassalization with Gujarat
  • Break vassalization with Kara Koyunlu
  • Break vassalization with Aden
  • Break vassalization with Hedjaz
  • Break vassalization with Timurid Empire
  • Break vassalization with Ak Koyunlu
  • Event 260008 - Ormuz submits to Portugal for Portugal is triggered immediately

Back to top

423001. Ormuz takes the cap of Xeque Ismail

ORM — Not random

Conditions

  • Portugal exists
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 7 non-colonial provinces

Triggered by

Action A of 254019 - The cap of Xeque Ismail for Persia

Description

In 1513 Xeque Ismail of Persia sent a cap to Ormuz demanding that Ormuz convert to the Shi'a form of Islam and submit to Persia. Before Cogeatar died he advised the Sultan of Ormuz to wear this cap and to allow the Portuguese to build a fortress in Ormuz. When King Terunxa of Ormuz took the cap the Persian ambassador Reys Hamad held him captive in his palace and ruled Ormuz as governor.

Actions

A. Accept the cap but switch allegiance to the Portuguese if they return

  • Break vassalization with Portugal
  • Break vassalization with Ottoman Empire
  • Break vassalization with Mamluks
  • Break vassalization with Gujarat
  • Break vassalization with Kara Koyunlu
  • Break vassalization with Aden
  • Break vassalization with Hedjaz
  • Break vassalization with Timurid Empire
  • Break vassalization with Ak Koyunlu
  • Change religion to shia
  • Monarch's administrative skill +3 for 18 months
  • Monarch's diplomatic skill +3 for 18 months
  • +150 relations with Persia
  • Event 254017 - Ormuz takes the cap of Xeque Ismail for Persia is triggered immediately

B. Refuse the cap and give allegiance to the Portuguese if they return

  • Break vassalization with Persia
  • Stability -1
  • -50 relations with Persia

C. Accept the cap but concede to the Portuguese as little as possible

  • Break vassalization with Portugal
  • Stability -3
  • Monarch's administrative skill +3 for 120 months
  • Monarch's diplomatic skill +3 for 120 months
  • +150 relations with Persia
  • Change religion to shia
  • Event 254017 - Ormuz takes the cap of Xeque Ismail for Persia is triggered immediately
  • Event 260009 - Ormuz is secured for Portugal for Portugal will never fire

D. Refuse the cap and concede to the Portuguese as little as possible

  • Break vassalization with Persia
  • Stability -4
  • -50 relations with Portugal
  • -50 relations with Persia
  • Event 260009 - Ormuz is secured for Portugal for Portugal will never fire

Back to top

423002. Ormuz takes the cap of Xeque Ismail

ORM — Not random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Portugal exists
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 7 non-colonial provinces

Triggered by

Action A of 254019 - The cap of Xeque Ismail for Persia

Description

In 1513 Xeque Ismail of Persia sent a cap to Ormuz demanding that Ormuz convert to the Shi'a form of Islam and submit to Persia. Before Cogeatar died he advised the Sultan of Ormuz to wear this cap. When King Terunxa of Ormuz took the cap the Persian ambassador Reys Hamad held him captive in his palace and ruled Ormuz as governor.

Actions

A. Accept the cap

  • Break vassalization with Ottoman Empire
  • Break vassalization with Mamluks
  • Break vassalization with Gujarat
  • Break vassalization with Kara Koyunlu
  • Break vassalization with Aden
  • Break vassalization with Hedjaz
  • Break vassalization with Timurid Empire
  • Break vassalization with Ak Koyunlu
  • Change religion to shia
  • Monarch's administrative skill +3 for 18 months
  • Monarch's diplomatic skill +3 for 18 months
  • +150 relations with Persia
  • Event 254017 - Ormuz takes the cap of Xeque Ismail for Persia is triggered immediately
  • Event 260009 - Ormuz is secured for Portugal for Portugal will never fire

B. Refuse the cap

  • Break vassalization with Persia
  • Stability -4
  • -50 relations with Persia
  • Event 260009 - Ormuz is secured for Portugal for Portugal will never fire
